relation: Great for these types of students
Campus PD does a great job.
Go to all home sporting events.
South Campus ProHo has a good buffet and The Nosh has a decent selection of food.
Oak hall is a nice place to live but there can be too many rules sometimes.
The classes can be challenging but the professors will work with you.
Make sure to get involved whenever you can. It is the best way to make yourself know. Also, do not be afraid to go to your professors for help.

This school is a diamond in the rough with good professors and a decent sized student body. Unfortunately, student life can be a drag with most of the students being commuters. I would give this university an 8/10 rating.
pageTitle: University of Missouri-St Louis (UMSL) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {441248=There is a few things to do for fun such as go downtown or go to the Delmar loop but the surrounding areas of the school aren't the nicest areas and there is not a lot of frat parties during the weekends., 15244=It's a lot to do for fun. The university usually has something fun going on but if not there was always something happening in St. Louis. For instance, Kevin Hart just made an appearance on Friday, April 13th. We also receive different discounts on events that come to the area, like Cardinal tickets!!, 248803=On campus you can hang out with friends. Go to the Library or even travel a couple miles down the highway or take the train which will connect you with the Delmar Loop which includes great restaurants, shopping, and many social activities. If you ride a little further you can connect with Downtown St. Louis which has many activities that are extremely fun., 11656=For future students: -Do not wait until the day of or before classes to buy your books or you will be standing in line for hours. -Arrive to school early to find a parking space. The most chaotic times for parking is 10:45-12:30 because thats around the time the 11:00 classes begin. Those are the most favorable classes and most people have those classes so there's literally no parking around that time., 447990=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 153123=Apply early, since scholarship deadlines are in March. Think about housing, but keep costs in mind., 61078=There are always, and I stress always, many great activities to do on and off campus. With a free metro-link and metro-bus pass you can get to downtown St. Louis and to the famous strip of the Delmar Loop to do just about anything and everything from concerts to shopping., 28801=The food is ok. The dining hall on south campus gets old after a while, and the meals are so expensive. I think the meal plan is a rip off. $1600 for 4 months? What 120 lb. girl can eat that much food? None of them.}

textAfterTable: Food and Dining einstein bagels is a great tasty treat for anytime of the day even between classes. Dorm Life i currently do not stay in a dorm. Academic Rigor you get a great education and you feel better about yourself knowing that you are taking that step. Tips for prospective students you should get involved, but not forget your studies along the way. time management is key. In three sentences this university is a great place to get an education. i have not found a bad thing about this university. a big plus is that they teach you time management.
